intro: Flindersia radulifera, commonly known as the red-flowered flindersia, is a tropical tree native to northern Australia and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The tree is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets. Its most striking feature is its clusters of bright red flowers, which appear in spring and attract various pollinators. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
